00092 /*
00093  * The library does not require to pass the current transaction as a
00094  * parameter to the functions (the current transaction is stored in a
00095  * thread-local variable).  One can, however, compile the library with
00096  * explicit transaction parameters.  This is useful, for instance, for
00097  * performance on architectures that do not support TLS or for easier
00098  * compiler integration.
00099  */
00100 struct stm_tx;
00101 # ifdef EXPLICIT_TX_PARAMETER
00102 #  define TXTYPE                        struct stm_tx *
00103 #  define TXPARAM                       struct stm_tx *tx
00104 #  define TXPARAMS                      struct stm_tx *tx,
00105 #  define TXARG                         (struct stm_tx *)tx
00106 #  define TXARGS                        (struct stm_tx *)tx,
00107 struct stm_tx *stm_current_tx();
00108 # else /* ! EXPLICIT_TX_PARAMETER */
00109 #  define TXTYPE                        void
00110 #  define TXPARAM                       /* Nothing */
00111 #  define TXPARAMS                      /* Nothing */
00112 #  define TXARG                         /* Nothing */
00113 #  define TXARGS                        /* Nothing */
00114 #endif /* ! EXPLICIT_TX_PARAMETER */
00115

00118  * ################################################################### */

00124 typedef uintptr_t stm_word_t;
00125 
00129 typedef struct stm_tx_attr {
00137   int id;
00146   unsigned int read_only : 1;
00155   unsigned int visible_reads : 1;
00161   unsigned int no_retry : 1;
00167   stm_word_t deadline;
00168 } stm_tx_attr_t;
00169 
00174 enum {
00178   STM_ABORT_EXPLICIT = (1 << 4),
00182   STM_ABORT_IMPLICIT = (1 << 5),
00187   STM_ABORT_RR_CONFLICT = (1 << 5) | (0x01 << 8),
00192   STM_ABORT_RW_CONFLICT = (1 << 5) | (0x02 << 8),
00197   STM_ABORT_WR_CONFLICT = (1 << 5) | (0x03 << 8),
00202   STM_ABORT_WW_CONFLICT = (1 << 5) | (0x04 << 8),
00206   STM_ABORT_VAL_READ = (1 << 5) | (0x05 << 8),
00210   STM_ABORT_VAL_WRITE = (1 << 5) | (0x06 << 8),
00214   STM_ABORT_VALIDATE = (1 << 5) | (0x07 << 8),
00218   STM_ABORT_RO_WRITE = (1 << 5) | (0x08 << 8),
00222   STM_ABORT_IRREVOCABLE = (1 << 5) | (0x09 << 8),
00226   STM_ABORT_KILLED = (1 << 5) | (0x0A << 8),
00230   STM_ABORT_SIGNAL = (1 << 5) | (0x0B << 8),
00234   STM_ABORT_OTHER = (1 << 5) | (0x0F << 8)
00235 };
